topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55554bc0636872436fa40000#post_55554bc0636872436fa40000
Eh; dreams most of the time don't make sense.

Mine are just stacks and stacks of objects in my subconscious strewn about with nonsensical physics.  The only time they really make any sense is when I'm aware I'm sleeping and as a result I make it into a X-rated dream.  I'm not even talking inception levels crazy, but like imagine a hoarder's house; that's basically what my dreams are where dvds/vcr tapes of movies I've seen, comics of things I've read, books and such are strewn about houses I've lived in and they're all stacked like a hoarder's house.  On the one hand it's kind of cool in a dream being able to play a movie you remember; on the other hand it makes my ocd have a panic and a half.

Probably the scariest dream I've had was that I accidentally made a mental image of a person I know realize that he was just a memory and caused him to freak out and beg for me not to wake up and the panic caused me to wake up with him screaming at me to not erase him.
